7 April 2009

Global Compact Annual Review 2008 To Be Released and Global Compact Stakeholder Letter    

On Wednesday, 8 April 2009, Georg Kell, Executive Director of the United Nations Global Compact, will present the Annual Review 2008 at the UN Spokesperson's daily noon briefing (12noon to 12:45pm ET). The Global Compact Annual Review 2008 takes stock of the broad array of efforts undertaken by business participants and other key stakeholders to advance the principles of the Global Compact.

Feel free to make the Annual Review as well as the press release and fact sheet available to journalists in your countries. Please do not forget to inform journalists that the Annual Review and all accompanying documents are under strict embargo until 9am ET on Wednesday, 8 April. The noon briefing will be broadcast live via webcast on www.un.org/webcast/. Please contact Gavin Power, Deputy Director of the UN Global Compact (powerg@un.org; +1-212-963-4681) or Matthias Stausberg, Global Compact Spokesperson, (stausberg@un.org; 1-917-214-1337) for further details.

The Annual Review 2008 will be sent to all Global Compact participants together with the annual Stakeholder Letter. Please find here a draft version of the stakeholder letter, which will be sent to business participants of the Global Compact. A similar version without reference to the Global Compact Leaders Summmit will be sent to other Global Compact stakeholders.

Adjustment of Policy on Communication on Progress (CoP)    

Beginning on 8 April, the Global Compact Office will begin communicating its refined COP policy to participants and other stakeholders. Following extensive deliberations with business and Local Networks and as discussed at last year's ALNF, the Global Compact Board, at its December 2008 meeting, has agreed to simplify the COP process, to clarify minimum requirements and to improve searchability:

    1. New business participants will be given one year from the date of joining to prepare and submit their first COP.

      2. During the first five years of participation, a COP must address at least two of the Global Compact’s four principle issue areas, while all must be addressed after five years.

        3. The COP submission form on the GC website will require additional information to improve searchability.

          4. The “inactive” participant status currently in use will be eliminated. Business participants that have been “non-communicating” for one year or more will be delisted and removed from the Global Compact website.

        The attached policy provides further clarification. The policy will become effective on 1 July 2009 for new business participants joining on or after this date. It will be applicable to all business participants as of 1 July 2011. Please visit the COP section of the Global Compact website for further information and guidance, or contact the Oliver Johner, COP Analyst in the Global Compact Office (johner@un.org). A comprehensive FAQ on the refined policy, as well as foreign language translations will be made available online shortly.

        The UN Global Compact Office with the collaboration of the Fundació Fòrum - Barcelona Center for the Support of the Global Compact is happy to announce the opening of registration for the VII Annual Local Networks Forum (ALNF) to be held on the 9th and 10th of June 2009 at the Sabanci Holding Headquarters, in Istanbul, Turkey.

        Please visit the following link to view the program and to register: http://www.vip.com.tr/alnfistanbul2009/

        AFRICA

        Regional Meeting for Global Compact Focal Points in Africa.     

        The powerpoint presentations of the Second Global Compact Regional Meeting Africa, 16-19 March 2009, are available at the Global Compact website. On 16 – 17 March, a workshop was organized with the World Bank Institute and UNODC for business and Global Compact Local Network focal points to discuss collective action tools and strategies to counter corruption in business operations. On 18 March, a conference was co-organized with the Global Compact Local Network Nigeria (Nigeria Economic Summit Group, Africa Leadership Forum and Nigeria Institute of International Affairs) for approximately 200 attendees from 19 African nations to debate strategies that assist companies in the fight against corruption (report forthcoming). Participants from 12 Global Compact Local Networks in Africa convened on 19 March to discuss key issues and challenges in creating sustainable networks within the region.

        VARIOUS

        Promote your Local Network through a free webinar.     

        The GCO is seeking to promote the initiative and your Local Network by offering web-based briefings (webinars) for media representatives in your region. The purpose of these webinars is to help journalists develop a better understanding of corporate responsibility, the mission and activities of the UN Global Compact, and the activities of your Local Network. The webinars are interactive, slide-based sessions that will take at most one hour. All that is needed to participate is access to a telephone and a computer with an Internet connection. A representative from the GCO will open the webinar with a presentation on CSR and the GC, followed by a presentation on the Local Network (by a LN representative) and a question-and-answer session (the precise agenda can of course be tailored to network needs). The webinar is free of charge. The GCO will bear all associated costs. Please note that, for now, the webinar is only available in English. Please contact Matthias Stausberg (stausberg@un.org) in the Global Compact Office for more information.
